description: Number of subwords of length n in the Golay-Rudin-Shapiro binary word A020987.
comments: Terms a(0)..a(13) verified and a(14)..a(32) computed using the first 2^32 terms of the GRS sequence. [_Joerg Arndt_, Jun 10 2012]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: J.-P. Allouche and J. Shallit, The ring of k-regular sequences, Theoretical Computer Sci., 98 (1992), 163-197.
example: All 8 subwords of length three (000, 001, ..., 111) occur in A020987, so a(3) = 8.
mathematica: CoefficientList[ Series[ (1 + x^2 + 2*x^3 + 4*x^4 + 4*x^6 - 2*x^7 - 2*x^9) / (1-x)^2, {x, 0, 36}], x] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 10 2013, after _Joerg Arndt_'s conjectured g.f. *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Jeffrey Shallit_.
extensions: Minor edits by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 06 2012
